answers.answer: Hi...well u have half the info...low or high stomach acid can cause the issues u r having, so u should have a PH test done to see which issue u r dealing with.Also, it is possible to have a motility issue with ur LES which could be causing ur issue....only a GI dr and some testing can tell u for sure.Try elevating the head of ur bed by at least 6 "....eat several small meals a day, and do not lie down for 3 to 4 hrs after eating...avoid dairy products later in the day as it can slow down an already slow LES."selma"

question: I have type 1 diabetes and get heartburn a whole lot.  Sometimes, especially when I am laying down, stomach acid will reflux back up into my mouth and burn my throat.  As far as I know, I do not have gastroparesis.  I read somewhere that low stomach acid can cause these symptoms, so I have started taking betaine hydrochloride on top of the digestive enzymes and probiotics that  I am already taking.  It does seem to help stave off heartburn, but not all the time.  My question is does or can diabetes cause low stomach acid?
title: Heartburn on Overdrive
